alert.note: Alert for Lake (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 09 at 11:20AM CDT until May 15 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee...Missouri... Mississippi River Above Tiptonville For the Lower Mississippi River...including Tiptonville, Caruthersville, Osceola...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Mississippi River Above Tiptonville. * WHEN...From this morning to early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 34.0 feet, Fields are flooding east of Point Pleasant, Missouri. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 28.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 34.2 feet Friday evening. - Action stage is 34.0 feet. - Flood stage is 37.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
